body:
Instrument the code with ETW (or other) events so that we can profile the implementation/add debugging info.

What instrumentation/infrastructure already exists here, and can we get a view of perf that is inclusive of both the native code and javascript?  Looking at one of the Facebook videos, it suggests there's already instrumentation available.

- [ ] Make sure the internal logging ETW stuff is manifest based.
- [ ] Verify that console is hookable for UWP impl.

title: [Onboarding] Consider first-party add-platform tool in @react-native-community/cli

milestone.title: MVP+ (vNext M5)
milestone.description:
After completing a MVP and moving vNext as the default template, this milestone covers work to fill out as much functionality as possible without requiring [WinUI 3](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/blob/master/docs/roadmap.md#winui-3). Thus it will not achieve 100% core parity, but will increase completion.

Items of note:
- Match lean core (moving components out to extensions)
- Turbo Module support

body:
Currently, we have an installer package that resolves the correct version of `react-native-windows` called `rnpm-plugin-windows`. We should consider dropping a proposal in [React Native Community Discussions & Proposals](https://github.com/react-native-community/discussions-and-proposals) to make a unified mechanism for adding platforms to a React Native project. E.g., today we require a CLI extension to install `react-native-windows` called `rnpm-plugin-windows`, but it would feel like a much more seamless experience if there was already a builtin tool for adding platforms to a React Native app.

E.g., if we had something like:
```
react-native add-platform <platform>
```
Which did the following:
1. Install a package named `react-native-<platform>@latest`
2. Call a "resolver" module from that package to correct the version (i.e., we may need to downgrade the version of `react-native-<platform>` to a package that is compatible with the currently installed version of React Native)
3. Call an "init" module which generates the boilerplate for the platform

cc @vincentriemer in case he has considered this before for `react-native-dom`.

title: Design wrapper for ListView control (make decision on whether or not to expose this)

milestone.title: MVP+ (vNext M5)
milestone.description:

Thus it will not achieve 100% core parity, but will increase completion.

Items of note:
- Match lean core (moving components out to extensions)
- Turbo Module support

body: Currently, the app dev needs to specify all aspects of how the items in a FlatList should look and behave. To improve ease of use and consistency across RN apps on Windows, we should provide a default state similar to what ListView provides in Xaml. Ideally, FlatList would have default states (rest, hover, pressed, selected, disabled), capability to arrow between items, and Narrator announcements of item in set with no or little dev work.

title: TransferProperties should be Pay-for-Play

milestone.title: MVP+ (vNext M5)
milestone.description:
After completing a MVP and moving vNext as the default template, this milestone covers work to fill out as much functionality as possible without requiring [WinUI 3](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/blob/master/docs/roadmap.md#winui-3). Thus it will not achieve 100% core parity, but will increase completion.

Items of note:
- Match lean core (moving components out to extensions)
- Turbo Module support

body:
Currently TransferProperties (especially notable in FrameworkElementViewManager) attempts to transfer every possible property, even if the property is not set.

Ideally this should be pay-for-play, the shadow node can keep track of what properties have actually been set.

Comparing 59.34 with 59.104 the cost of TransferProperties has doubled.
23ms to 49ms in my app.

before:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48095233/61915404-1b529f00-aef9-11e9-8a82-c195385648cc.png)

after:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48095233/61915417-273e6100-aef9-11e9-8c3b-28010534af9d.png)

Traces and symbols here:
\\scratch2\scratch\stecrain\TransferProperties

title: Remove forked Switch.tsx/js file from RNW

milestone.title: MVP+ (vNext M5)
milestone.description:
After completing a MVP and moving vNext as the default template, this milestone covers work to fill out as much functionality as possible without requiring [WinUI 3](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/blob/master/docs/roadmap.md#winui-3). Thus it will not achieve 100% core parity, but will increase completion.

Items of note:
- Match lean core (moving components out to extensions)
- Turbo Module support

body:
<!-- This is a template for new feature or API proposals for React Native Windows. Use this to submit new API/component requests or behavior updates that are specific to Windows-only. For feature requests to React Native, go [here](https://github.com/react-native-community/discussions-and-proposals) instead. 

It's fine if you don't have all the details for the template below: you can start with the Summary and Rationale. Read more about React Native for Windows proposal process [here](https://github.com/microsoft/react-native-windows/tree/master/vnext/proposals)
-->

# Proposal: Remove forked Switch.tsx/js file from RNW
<!-- Add a title for your feature or API proposal. Please be short and descriptive -->

## Summary
<!-- Brief explanation of the new API or change. -->

We should remove the forked Switch.tsx/js file once we sync a release of RN that contains [this commit](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/commit/b782934f3f2a80ae7e3872cc7d7a610aa6680ec4).

## Motivation

<!-- Why are we doing this? What use cases does it support? What is the expected outcome? Why should this be done for Windows-only?

Please focus on explaining the motivation so that if this proposal is not accepted, the motivation could be used to develop alternative solutions. In other words, enumerate the constraints you are trying to solve without coupling them too closely to the solution you have in mind. -->

We wanted to fix a bug in the Switch component in which it would toggle excessively after being invoked once. The fix was committed to RNW first so that the bug would be resolved more quickly for apps that depend on RNW, since it was the only platform visibly showing the bug. However, since the fix was applicable to other platforms using RN as well, there was an ask to port the fix to RN so that RNW doesn't have a fork of Switch.tsx/js from RN if it doesn't need to.

The fix has now been committed to RN. This issue is to track work to remove the fork when RNW gets that commit from RN.

title: Picker items should take Text styles

milestone.title: MVP+ (vNext M5)
milestone.description:
After completing a MVP and moving vNext as the default template, this milestone covers work to fill out as much functionality as possible without requiring [WinUI 3](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/blob/master/docs/roadmap.md#winui-3). Thus it will not achieve 100% core parity, but will increase completion.

Items of note:
- Match lean core (moving components out to extensions)
- Turbo Module support

body:
# Proposal: Picker items should take Text styles

## Summary
Currently, Picker items only have View props, not Text props.  This makes it impossible to change their font and font size, among other things.  It would be nice to be able to customize the children more easily, or use arbitrary child elements, though for my purposes simply being able to change those two properties (font and font size) would be sufficient.

## Motivation

<!-- Why are we doing this? What use cases does it support? What is the expected outcome? Why should this be done for Windows-only?

Please focus on explaining the motivation so that if this proposal is not accepted, the motivation could be used to develop alternative solutions. In other words, enumerate the constraints you are trying to solve without coupling them too closely to the solution you have in mind. -->

I am attempting to create search filters using Picker in RNW, but the built-in font and font size in Picker items does not match the design I am trying to implement, and there is no apparent way to change them from typescript. Seeing as they are essentially plain text boxes, I expected their props to reflect that and include text styling.  I believe the IOS Picker already supports this through an itemStyle prop, which would also be helpful.

## Open Questions

Could we ever see child components for these Picker Items?  I'd love to be able to do something like:
<Picker.Item>
    \<Text\>Color:\</Text\>
    \<Text\>Blue\</Text\>
</Picker.Item>

body:
Split out from #2111
https://facebook.github.io/react-native/docs/layout-props#overflow

overflow controls how children are measured and displayed. overflow: hidden causes views to be clipped while overflow: scroll causes views to be measured independently of their parents main axis. It works like overflow in CSS (default: visible). See https://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Web/CSS/overflow for more details.

title: [Module] Add PlatformConstants module

milestone.title: MVP+ (vNext M5)
milestone.description:
After completing a MVP and moving vNext as the default template, this milestone covers work to fill out as much functionality as possible without requiring [WinUI 3](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/blob/master/docs/roadmap.md#winui-3). Thus it will not achieve 100% core parity, but will increase completion.

Items of note:
- Match lean core (moving components out to extensions)
- Turbo Module support

body:
The `PlatformConstants` module is used on iOS and Android to match the native bridge implementation with the current JavaScript bundle. It is also used to send platform-specific information to JavaScript. 

I can see us using the `PlatformConstants` module to include:
1. Information about the current API version for UWP, e.g., how [Android](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/blob/master/ReactAndroid/src/main/java/com/facebook/react/modules/systeminfo/AndroidInfoModule.java#L71-L72) exposes SDK info
2. Information about the current device family, e.g., how [Android](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/blob/master/ReactAndroid/src/main/java/com/facebook/react/modules/systeminfo/AndroidInfoModule.java#L45-L61) exposes UI mode.
3. React Native version info for ensuring JavaScript bundles are created for the correct native version.

title: NM: Add support for JS objects as parameters / return types

milestone.title: MVP (vNext M4)
milestone.description:
This "MVP" milestone tracks implementation of as much of RN core without significant workarounds current XAML (which would require [WinUI 3](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/blob/master/docs/roadmap.md#winui-3)).

- vNext is the default template (with vCurrent available as a fallback for compat for existing apps)
- Native Modules ready to be developed
- Measured percentage of lean core API completion (specific target percentage TBD)
- Built on [WinUI 2.x](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/)

body: Native Module developers should be able to define custom structs with primitive fields, and use them as parameters/return values in the their native methods. We should then therefore be able to convert to/from JS objects and those structs.
